TenderName: RFQ-DMT-RFP-25-060 Upgrade the Infrastructure (ME9-ME12)–MBZ (Construction)
EntityName: ADPIC - Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT)
TenderDetails:
Project Title: Upgrade the Infrastructure in Sectors (ME9-ME12) – MBZ
RFP for Package (43) Main Contractor – Upgrade the infrastructure in Sector ME9 & Z17-01

This RFP is for the construction Package 43 related to the upgrade of infrastructure in Sector ME9 (MBZ City). A detailed and coordinated design has been developed. However, please note that ‘Infrastructure upgrades in ME9 (MBZ City) – Package 43’ is part of a wider programme of works under the wide MBZ City enhancement initiative. In summary, the Scope of Works for the whole of the MBZ City enhancement initiative includes the following: Road condition improvements.
• Public realm improvements (parks, landscaping, walkways and cycle tracks).
• Community Facilities Improvements: construction of more than one hundred community buildings for a variety of uses.
• Traffic and safety improvements around schools.
• Construction of multi-storey car parks.
CategoryDescriptionEn: Building and Facility Construction and Maintenance Services - Heavy construction services
CategoryDescriptionAr: خدمات إنشاء المباني والمرافق والصيانة - خدمات الإنشاء الثقيلة
tender_title: RFQ-DMT-RFP-25-060 Upgrade the Infrastructure (ME9-ME12)–MBZ (Construction)

TenderName: RFQ-Provision of Construction Services for Abu Dhabi Pearls Center at Delma Island
TenderDetails:
PUBLIC TENDER ANNOUNCEMENT: - Brief Scope:

Environment Agency – Abu Dhabi (EAD) is would like to undertake a project to construct the Lulu Abu Dhabi Pearls Center, a medium-sized facility on Dalma Island dedicated to advancing the traditional pearl industry, fostering public education, and serving as a cultural-tourism landmark. The project comprises a 1,075 sqm main center building housing exhibition galleries, pearl‐processing laboratories and multi-use spaces; an 80 sqm substation building for utility infrastructure; two accommodation and kitchen blocks totaling 510 sqm for on-site staff and guest quarters; approximately 7,500 sqm of landscaped gardens, pathways and outdoor interpretive displays; and 14 shaded parking bays conveniently located close to the main entrance. 

Duration: 10 Months
CategoryDescriptionEn: Building and Facility Construction and Maintenance Services - Nonresidential building construction services
CategoryDescriptionAr: خدمات إنشاء المباني والمرافق والصيانة - خدمات إنشاء مباني غير سكنية
tender_title: RFQ-Provision of Construction Services for Abu Dhabi Pearls Center at Delma Island

EntityName: ADPIC - Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT)
TenderDetails:
Revision 1 - Additional Scope of Services and Amended Commercial Particulars:

The DMT is working to implement leading industry asset management practices to ensure that municipal assets are maintained efficiently through the assets’ life cycle and continue to provide the required levels of service.

The existing asset management framework and tools implemented within the affiliated entities of DMT setup for further development/improvement of the asset management processes, procedures, and system enhancement including asset inventory & condition, data collection, data analysis, information and maintenance operation management is in progress.

TenderName: RFQ-Provision of ServiceNow Platform Services
TenderDetails:
The Department of Government Enablement has published this RFP for developing a government wide pricelist. The developed government wide pricelist will be utilized by all Abu Dhabi Government Entities for procuring the ServiceNow Platform Services based on their demand/requirement. Through this RFP, the Department of Government Enablement intends to select competent suppliers, unify the scope of services, and standardize the prices across all Abu Dhabi Government Entities to maximize spend efficiency.
As an outcome of the RFP process and based on the evaluations, the Department of Government Enablement may award multiple suppliers for providing the ServiceNow Platform Services to the Abu Dhabi Government Entities.
CategoryDescriptionEn: Information Technology Broadcasting and Telecommunications - Software
CategoryDescriptionAr: تقنية المعلومات الإذاعة والاتصالات - برامج
tender_title: RFQ-Provision of ServiceNow Platform Services

The objective is to rework, remediate, stabilize, and deploy the existing system, not rebuild it from scratch. TenderName: RFQ-DMT-RFP-25-223 Underpass (Intersection of Khaleej Al Arabi/Sheik Shakhbout)
EntityName: ADPIC - Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT)
TenderDetails:
Project: Development of the Tunnel at the Intersection of Khaleej Al Arabi with Sheikh Shakhbout Bin Sultan Street and Two Bridges (RFP for Construction of Underpass). The objective of the Khaleej Al Arabi Junction Improvements – Construction of Underpass Project is to enhance connectivity and accessibility whilst reducing traffic congestion from Abu Dhabi Island as part of the “Plan Capital” urban structure framework.
The Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT) is seeking the services of a capable and experienced Contractor, with a reputable experience to construct the Khaleej Al Arabi Underpass to serve the future development of Hudairiyat island. The proposed underpass is planned to be 2x2 carriageways starting from IP 79 to IP 134 to serve the future development of Hudairiyat island. The underpass will contribute to enhance the traffic flow along Shakhbout Bin Sultan Street especially at the signalized junction IP 79, IP 135, and IP 134.

TenderName: RFQ-Re Tender -DCD/2025/0619-Damj Award Event Q1 2026
TenderDetails:
An approved initiative under the Abu Dhabi People of Determination Strategy launched by His Highness Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan in 2020, the Abu Dhabi Excellence Award for People of Determination Inclusion is a dedicated scheme recognizing and rewarding outstanding public, private, and third sector entities for their achievements in following: 
•	Inclusive Services - 6 awards
o	Best Inclusive Healthcare Service 
o	Best inclusive Education Service 
o	Best Inclusive Entertainment/Tourism Service 
o	Best Inclusive Mobility and Transport Service 
o	Best Inclusive Service in the Third Sector
•	Inclusive Employment - 2 awards
o	Best Inclusive Work Environment for Employing People of Determination
•	Accessibility in Physical & Digital Environments - 2 awards
o	Best Entity for Accessible Environment (Physical & Digital)
The award has a strategic Impact to the emirate of Abu Dhabi as It reinforces the sustainability of inclusion efforts across all sectors, ensuring lasting impact for People of Determination, also It will elevate Abu Dhabi as a pioneer in building inclusive urban communities globally.

EntityName: ADPIC - Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT)
TenderDetails:
Project: Construction of Asphalt Roads for Farms in Mahadir Liwa (Western Mahadir) Phase – 2
Package: Construction

Department of Municipalities and Transport, hereinafter called (DMT or The Employer) intends to appoint an experienced Contractor to perform the Construction of asphalt road for farms in Mahadir Liwa (Western Mahadir) - Phase 2 along with road alignment adjustment, proposed surface drainage, utility relocation, and street lighting network.

This project is for the Construction of internal road works (single carriageway), embankment and slope protection, traffic signs and marking, Street lighting network, surface storm water, protection/relocation of the existing services, and spare ducts.

TenderName: RFQ-Provision of Construction Services for Underwater Marine Museum
TenderDetails:
PUBLIC TENDER ANNOUNCEMENT: - Brief Scope:

The Environment Agency Abu Dhabi (EAD) is seeking to collaborate with a single bidder to deliver a comprehensive solution for the construction, production, transportation, deployment, completion, and handover of the Underwater Marine Museum. The scope of work includes executing all tasks according to the design and at the specified project location.
The selected bidder must have proven experience in similar projects and a team of qualified construction professionals.
The Contractor staff must include a team of qualified Marine, Structural and Civil Engineers, Technical Diving Team, Quantity Surveyors, and Planning Engineers…. etc. 
The contractor's scope of work includes the construction, completion, and handover of the project. This scope shall include, but is not limited to, the following:
•	Preliminaries: Provide lay-down area for Project element production and preparation to transport, the lay-down area preferred to be at one of Abu Dhabi Ports. Liaise with local authorities and obtain any required Permits, NOC’s.
•	Element Production: the contractor has to fabricate and build all project elements including the supply of any required molds and appoint any required specialists to complete the works.
•	Site Preparation: Preparing the seabed to receive the Museum Elements.
•	Transportation & Installation: the contractor shall transport the Elements safely and install the Museum Elements at the specific location as per the design to the seabed level.
•	Defect Liability Period: the contractor shall maintain and replace any defected elements during this period.
CategoryDescriptionEn: Engineering and Research and Technology Based Services - Earth science services
CategoryDescriptionAr: خدمات مستندة إلى الهندسة والبحث والتقنية - خدمات علوم أرضية
tender_title: RFQ-Provision of Construction Services for Underwater Marine Museum

TenderName: RFQ-DMT-RFP-25-222 Tunnel Development Khaleej Al Arabi / Sheikh Shakhbout bin Sultan
EntityName: ADPIC - Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT)
TenderDetails:
The Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT) is seeking the services of a capable and experienced Contractor to undertake the Design and Build of Two Bridges which is a package of work that forms part of the wider Khaleej Al Arabi Project and required to be completed through a Fixed price Lump Sum Construction Contract.

Shakbhout Bin Sultan Street is a 3 x 3 lane boulevard road providing connectivity to and from Hudariyat Island. The objective of the Project is to provide free flow traffic to and from Hudariyat Island. It is proposed to upgrade the existing signalized intersections; IP134 and IP 134A at 8th and 32nd Street respectively via grade separation. A 2-lane bridge ramp connecting 32nd Street to Shakhbout Bin Sultan Street and A 1 x 1 lane bridge on 8th Street spanning Shakbhout Bin Sultan Street is proposed.
